title: Top Bing Searches
description: Do you want to know what people in the United States (and around the World) search for most on Bing as of 2021? Here are the top 100 search queries.
content: Joshua Hardwick Head of Content @ Ahrefs (or, in plain English, I'm the guy responsible for ensuring that every blog post we publish is EPIC). Get the week's best marketing content Email Subscription Subscribe Leave this field empty if you're human: Contents Do you want to know what people are searching for on Bing as of 2021?Here‚Äôs the data we‚Äôll be sharing in this post:Top 100 most searched queries on Bing (US): the most popular searches (by volume) for the US as of 2021.Top 100 most searched queries on Bing (Worldwide): the same data as above, but global stats. That means global search volumes.But first, a quick tip for those of you doing Bing keyword research:You can find Bing search volumes (and more) for 124 million keywords in Ahrefs‚Äô Keywords Explorer.Now let‚Äôs get to the data‚Ä¶Top 100 Bing searches in the US#KeywordSearch Volume1facebook12,983,8212youtube11,452,7223google8,060,6984gmail6,043,2835bing homepage windows 10692,54075instagram691,84376drudge report690,82277music687,85578target687,85579news685,60280horse racing682,94481cnn678,01682esports670,31683best buy669,44184google translate668,24185aol com610,25894boxing602,96395solitaire595,76696chase594,38897indeed588,89398cycling582,26399realtor.com566,653100usps tracking562,617Sidenote. This was also the case with the most popular Google search queries.It‚Äôs clear right away that branded queries dominate this list.A whopping 61% of them revolve around well-known brands and websites.Many of the queries are not only branded but navigational‚Äîi.e., folks using Bing to search for particular websites or login pages.Here are some examples of such queries:#KeywordSearch Volume1facebook log in3,201,6212gmail login1,328,7013ebay official site695,7664yahoo mail login624,879Did you notice the same thing as I did?There are a lot of people trying to access Facebook via Bing.So many, in fact, that Facebook-related queries (e.g., ‚ÄúFacebook,‚Äù Facebook login,‚Äù ‚Äúwww.facebook.com,‚Äù etc.) make up 10.68% of the total search volume from the top 100.You might also have noticed an interesting query in 3rd place‚Äî‚ÄùGoogle.‚ÄùBelieve it or not, there are 8 million monthly US searches for ‚ÄúGoogle‚Äù on Bing.That‚Äôs people using one search engine (Bing) to find another (Google).Just in case you‚Äôre one of those people, here‚Äôs a quick trick üòâ -You may also have noticed that there are quite a few queries from seemingly frustrated Windows 10 users looking for help.#KeywordSearch Volume1fix connections to bluetooth audio devices and wireless displays in windows 10805,1832how to get help in windows 10692,540Amazingly, those two searches alone account for 0.94% of all search volume across the top 100.No searches related to Windows 10 (or any version of Windows for that matter) appear on our list of the top 100 Google search queries. So what‚Äôs going on here?This is actually the result of a strange quirk in Windows 10.You see, when you press the F1 key in Windows 10, it opens up your browser window and searches for ‚Äúget help with file explorer in windows 10‚Äù or something similar (it varies depending on the application you‚Äôre using).Long story short, most of these searches are almost certainly accidental.Now let‚Äôs take a look at the top 100 Worldwide Bing searches.Top 100 Bing searches globally#KeywordSearch file1,125,27576nascar1,086,82477youtube videos1,059,33078wwe1,058,94279science1,037,43380nhl1,036,06381google docs1,018,23182west1,017,47483northeast1,015,85984bbc news1,015,05785south1,004,99286mma1,001,33687soccer995,28088midwest988,50389technology974,18990y958,25391zillow955,54392cfb950,35593wells fargo943,27194africa937,96895hotmail.com931,59896google drive920,31397yahoo mail login918,74898indeed909,04799local news896,385100c√≥mo obtener ayuda en windows 10895,284It‚Äôs not just US users that use Bing to access Google.The most popular Worldwide search query on Bing is ‚ÄúGoogle‚Äù‚Äîand by quite a hefty margin too. There are a whopping 40.96M searches for ‚ÄúGoogle‚Äù on Bing every month‚Äîthat accounts for 13.2% of all worldwide search volume. Crazy!But the similarities don‚Äôt end there:68% of the top 100 US searches also appear on the worldwide list.Sidenote. The Worldwide list does include all US searches, which may be part of the reason for the significant overlap. Here are a few notable searches that are popular around the world but not in the US:#KeywordSearch Volume1google chrome2,600,0002outlook1,400,0003google search1,020,0004chrome777,0005daily mail729,0006friv710,0007youtube music706,000The most interesting observation here is that people around the world seem to be using Bing to download Google Chrome‚ÄîGoogle‚Äôs web browser.Not only does that mean that many people are unhappy with their current browser‚Äîwhich is likely to be Microsoft Edge if they‚Äôre using Bing‚Äîbut also their current search engine.A fun point here is that Google Chrome defaults to Google search‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ meaning that this will be the last Bing search ever for those people.Should you really care about Bing?Hands up who uses Google as their primary search engine?I‚Äôm sensing a lot of raised hands‚Ä¶ which is hardly surprising.Google has an estimated Worldwide market share of 91.38%. Bing‚Äôs market share is 2.69%.So for every search performed on Bing, roughly 34 searches are conducted on Google.Now, I couldn‚Äôt find any statistics about the number of daily searches on Bing. However, according to internetlivestats.com, 3.5 billion searches are performed on Google every day.If we run a few numbers, we can work out that Bing likely gets around 82.6M searches per day.Sidenote. Want to know what folks are searching for on Google? Here are the top Google searches.Conclusion: Bing still matters.Which brings me onto:See more Bing search data in Keywords ExplorerLooking to find out how many searches a particular word or phrase gets on Bing every month?Go to Ahrefs‚Äô Keywords Explorer, enter a query and choose Bing as the search engine.Let‚Äôs see how many searches there are for ‚ÄúPhotoshop‚Äù each month in the US.19,000. Then a further 41,000 searches from elsewhere around the globe.However, there‚Äôs more‚Ä¶If we hit go to the Questions report, we see some of the other Photoshop-related searches people make using Bing, plus their respective search volumes.Looks like a fair few people are struggling to remove backgrounds in Photoshop! That could make for a nice tutorial!Fancy researching some topics of your own? Try our free Keyword Generator.
